description: A smooth, high-quality combination of real rice and butter is made with sugar and cooked to clear, white-hot perfection when served with other dishes.
ingredients: 1 cup uncooked, moderate grain rice, brown or white only
directions: Combine rice, salt and water in a 2- to 3-quart saucepan. Heat to boiling; stir once or twice.
Reduce heat; cover and simmer 5 minutes. Add half and half and granulated sugar; stir once or twice, cover and continue to simmer 10 minutes, or until rice is tender.
Meanwhile, place butter in small skillet over low heat.
Cook until butter is light brown and smells like roasted nuts, about 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Sprinkle brown sugar over cooked rice and top with browned butter. Serve hot and plain but pair this rice with other main dishes.

name: Brown Rice Curry
description: A red-hot combination of brown rice and curry powder is made with real vegetables, cooked to fresh perfection, and served with other meals. Keep the stock absorbed into the rice so when you wake up and yawn, all you have to do is pair this curry-based rice dish with other main dishes.
ingredients: 1 onion, finely chopped, red, white, or yellow only
directions: Add the fresh stock to a large pot and bring to a boil.
Add all the ingredients before sautéing with the olive oil.
Reduce to a simmer. Cover and cook until stock has been absorbed into rice.
Average cooking time is 60 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes and fluff with a fork. Serve hot and plain but pair this curry-based rice dish with other main dishes in a large plate.

name: Burrito Supreme Casserole
description: This red-hot, meaty casserole is made with flour tortillas, ground beef, real cheese, vegetables, fruit juice, avocado, and taco seasoning and packed with refried beans, as it delivers a bold aroma that it relishes. Cheese sauce and hot sauce occasionally work for this, too.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cup tomato juice or (1 cup tomato sauce)
directions: Wrap tortillas securely in aluminum foil and bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
Combine tomato juice (or tomato sauce), seasoning mix, and oil and stir well then set aside.
Cook ground beef in a large skillet until browned stirring to crumble, then drain well.
Stir in beans and ½ cup tomato juice (or tomato sauce) mixture.
Bring to boil then cover and reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes stirring, occasionally. Remove from heat.
Place ¼ cup beef mixture and 2½ tablespoons cheese down the center of each tortilla.
Roll up tortillas and place seam side down in a lightly greased rectangular baking dish.
Pour remaining tomato juice (or tomato sauce) mixture over casserole then cover and bake at 350°F for 35 minutes.
Uncover and sprinkle with remaining cheese, then bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese melts.
Peel and cube avocado and toss with lemon juice.
Sprinkle avocado, lettuce and tomato over the casserole. Serve hot and plain or with other side dishes and drizzle with the cheese sauce and/or hot sauce, if desired.

name: Cameroonian Peanut Soup
description: This is a savory, rich and meaty peanut soup. You can make the peanut soup bolder by adding herbs and spices.
ingredients: 3 cups chicken broth or chicken stock
2 medium onions, minced, red, white, or yellow only
carrot, chopped fine or one sweet potato or yams, boiled and mashed
cup of natural unsweetened peanut butter
directions: Combine all ingredients except the peanut butter.
Simmer over medium heat until everything is tender.
Reduce heat, add the peanut butter and simmer for a few minutes more. Stir often.
Soup should be thick and smooth. Serve hot and plain or with any main dish or side dish.

name: Chinese Pork Salad
description: Pork Recipes by the South Carolina Department of Agriculture, public domain government resource—original source of recipe
ingredients: 1 lb. pork strips (loin eye, stir-fry, or fillet)
1/2 cup Oriental stir-fry sauce or (4 3/4 tbsp. oyster sauce)
1/2 red onion, peeled and thinly sliced
2 x 10-oz. packages frozen pea pods, thawed and drained
directions: Marinate pork strips in sauce for 30 minutes.
In a large, non-stick skillet, stir-fry pork and onion over medium-high heat for about 4–5 minutes.
In a large bowl, toss all ingredients together. Serve warm and plain or with other side dishes.

name: Crispy Kangkong
description: Deep-fried kangkong leaves coated with the fresh egg, water, cornstarch, flour, salt, and pepper mixture are cooked to a smooth, golden-brown crisp and great for other main dishes, side dishes, or appetizers. Aioli, Thousand Island dressing, or ranch dressing sometimes works for this for dipping, too.
directions: Remove the kangkong leaves. Wash with water and dry.
Mix the egg, water, cornstarch, flour, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
Add the kangkong leaves and mix until all the leaves are coated with the batter.
Heat cooking oil in a pan. Fry the leaves until crispy and golden brown.
Strain the cooked pieces for excess oil. Serve hot and plain over any vegetable, or with other side dishes, main dishes, or appetizers.

name: Garlic Lemon Rice
description: This white-hot recipe has tangy secrets: garlic and lemon. An all-time traditional classic for fried rice - you can cook this with other vegetables and herbs the hot way. With sour aroma and fluffy, divine flavor, every scoop of rice is pure lemon power!
ingredients: 1/2 cup sliced onion, red, white, or yellow only
2 1/2 cups cooked rice, with brown rice separated at 2 cups and wild rice at 1/2 cup
directions: Cook celery and onion in oil in a large skillet over moderate-high heat until tender crisp.
Mix with garlic and cook an additional minute.
Add brown rice, wild rice, salt, white pepper, and lemon juice; stir until thoroughly heated.
Serve hot and plain but pair this fruit-based rice with other main dishes in a fresh, large plate. Garnish with the lemon zest, if desired.

name: Garlic-Herb Pretzels
description: Who says garlic is pricey for exotic food preparation? This tangy pretzel is made with real herbs and is great for side dishes or appetizers, as it delivers a white-hot aroma that it relishes.
ingredients: 6 tbsp. butter, melted, reserving 3 tbsp. for drizzling
1 tbsp. salt, kosher, rock, or iodized only
1 tbsp. sugar, brown or white only
directions: Dissolve baking powder (optional) and yeast in water and butter. Add salt and sugar.
Blend or mix with 2 cups flour.
Crush garlic and add with herbs.
Add 2 cups more flour, and more if dough is too sticky.
Roll into snakes or lines and shape. Sprinkle with kosher salt, if desired.
Bake at 425° F for 10 – 15 minutes or until browned. Serve hot and plain or with other appetizers or side dishes. Drizzle with the remaining melted butter.

name: Ginger-Pork Dumplings
description: These dumplings are delicious whether you put the classic pleats in them or not. Keep the ginger and pork appetizing to make it savory with other side dishes, appetizers, or main dishes.
ingredients: 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, plus additional for dusting
3/4 lb. .ground pork (from the shoulder only; not lean)
directions: Mix flour and half a cup lukewarm water in a fresh, large bowl until the dough forms.
Knead on a lightly floured surface until all the lumps have been removed.
Wrap the dough in plastic for 10 - 12 minutes at room temperature.
Chop half the ginger into fine little bits and cut the other half into small one-inch sticks. Add ½ cup of soy sauce to the longer sticks of ginger.
Chop the scallions and add them to a fresh bowl with pork, finely chopped ginger, and the remaining ½ cup soy sauce. Mix the contents of the bowl and then chill.
Roll the dough into a 26-inch sheet that is less than ⅛ of an inch thick. Cut out 24 round shapes.
Add 2 teaspoons of pork mix to the dumplings. Pinch the edges to seal.
Boil dumplings for 6 - 8 minutes. Serve warm and plain over white rice, or with any side dish, appetizer, or main dish.

name: Greek-style Zucchini Fritters
description: The perfect way to start the day - a rich Greek take on real zucchini, feta, and herbs is great on side dishes and appetizers and delivers a blissful taste that it relishes.
ingredients: 2 cups zucchini, grated and squeezed to drain
3 handful fresh herbs, such as parsley, dill, and mint, chopped
2 tbsp. oil, olive, canola, vegetable, or corn only
directions: Mix the zucchini, herbs, green onion, feta, flour, egg, salt and pepper in a bowl.
Heat the oil in a pan.
Spoon the zucchini mixture into the pan and cook until golden-brown on both sides, about 4 minutes per side. Serve hot and plain or with other side dishes or appetizers.

name: Japanese Hotdog
description: This Japanese sausage dish is made imperial to the taste and topped with nori sheets, wasabi, and mayonnaise, named in honor of the Japanese hot-dog eating champion Takeru Kobayashi. Ranch dressing sometimes replaces mayonnaise and then works for this for drizzling, too.
directions: Steam each beef hot dog in a small pan for 5 minutes.
Place a hot dog in each bun. Top each with half of the mayonnaise (optional), teriyaki sauce, green onions, and crumbled nori. Serve warm with other side dishes or appetizers

name: Liver Dumplings
description: This liver-based recipe is wrapped with the dough and used as an appetizer or side dish. Chili powder and scallions work for this recipe, too. With meaty aroma and bold taste, every piece of dumpling is red-hot, poultry fun!
ingredients: 1 small onion, minced, red or yellow only
2 1/2 tbsp. salt, reserving 2 tbsp. for the chicken and liver mixture
2 3/4 cups of flour, reserving 3/4 cups for dusting or (16 dumpling wrappers)
directions: Mix all the ingredients together.
Wrap the chicken and liver mixture with the dough (or dumpling wrappers). Drop into the boiling water by the 5 ½ teaspoonfuls.
Cook about 15 minutes or until done. As the batter is too thick, you can add a little water.
Drain and serve hot and plain or with the soup.

name: Mashed Pumpkin
description: A sweet alternative to the mashed potatoes, this modern pumpkin dish is enriched with butter to get the good consistency. Cicely sometimes works for this for garnishing, too.
directions: Clean the pumpkin well, being careful to remove manure or dirt. Chop off the stem.
Cook the cleaned pumpkin in a 375° F oven for approx 45 minutes per 250g. A small pumpkin of less than 500 grams works best.
Remove the pumpkin and allow to rest for 5–10 minutes. During this time, take out sea salt, butter, and your pepper mill.
Chop the pumpkin in half with the cleaver or the chef's knife.
Remove seeds and guts; roast seeds and discard the rest.
Separate the skin from the flesh.
Place hot pumpkin flesh in a food processor, along with salt, pepper, and butter to taste. Repeat steps 1 through 7 per pumpkin.
Serve warm and plain or with other vegetables, appetizers, or side dishes.

name: Middle Eastern Stuffed Eggplant
description: This bold, red-hot Middle-Eastern dish is made, mixed, and packed with real vegetables, ground lamb, herbs, and spices, and is great with rice or other main dishes cooked to golden-brown perfection. Leftover cooked lamb or beef sometimes works for this recipe, too.
ingredients: 1/3 cup chopped onion, red, white, or yellow only
1/3 cup chopped green pepper, with Jalapeño and green bell pepper mixed
1/4 cup (1 ounce) grated cheese (Monterey Jack, Cheddar, Colby, Swiss, or Asiago)
directions: Cut off the cap of the eggplant; cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out pulp, leaving a ¼-inch shell.
Chop the pulp; cover with water and cook about 5 minutes. Drain; set aside.
Cook lamb in a medium skillet until meat is no longer pink, stirring to crumble. Add onion, celery and green pepper; cook until tender crisp.
Pour off fat. Stir rice, tomato, salt, basil, thyme, black pepper, and eggplant pulp into vegetables.
Fill eggplant shells. Spoon any extra rice mixture into small baking dish. Place eggplant halves in a shallow, baking dish; bake at 350° F/180° C for 20 minutes.
Sprinkle with cheese; bake 5 minutes longer. Serve hot and plain over rice, or with other main dishes or vegetables.

name: Mushroom and Sunchoke Sauté
description: A red-hot combination of mushrooms and sunchokes is made and packed with real herbs and vegetables and is a new vegetarian main dish that the whole family relishes and enjoys.
ingredients: 2 lb. assorted mushrooms, shiitake, matsutake, or enokitake
directions: Trim off any soil caked onto mushrooms.
Trim and discard discolored stem ends and tough stems of shiitakes.
Quickly immerse the mushrooms in water, swishing them around to release soil and insects, then lift from water and drain.
Cut large mushrooms into about 1-inch pieces; leave the small mushrooms whole.
Peel and coarsely chop the sunchokes.
In a 5- to 6-quart pan over high heat, combine oil, butter, mushrooms, sunchokes, shallots, and garlic.
Stir often until mushroom juices evaporate and the vegetables are browned, about 15 minutes.
Add rosemary, oregano, and sherry; stir until sherry evaporates, about 2 minutes. Serve warm and plain or with other main dishes but spoon the cooked mushrooms and sunchokes in a large plate.

name: Oven-Baked French Fries
description: A crisp alternative to french fries is mixed and made with real cheese, salt, and spices and baked to smooth perfection. Gravy sometimes works for this for dipping, too.
ingredients: 1 tsp. salt, iodized or rock only
16 oz. frozen crinkle cut French-fried potatoes
directions: Preheat an oven to 450° F. Combine cheese, paprika, 1 teaspoon salt, and 3 teaspoons black pepper, or to taste.
Place potatoes in a medium bowl coated with the cooking spray.
Sprinkle potatoes with cheese mixture, tossing well. Arrange potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet coated with the cooking spray.
Bake at 450° F for 13 minutes or until tender. Serve warm and plain or with other side dishes, main dishes, or appetizers.

name: Parmesan-roasted Asparagus
description: Copyright 2002, Barefoot Contessa Family Style, All rights reserved
ingredients: 2 lemons, cut in wedges, for serving
directions: Preheat the oven to 400° F.
If the stalks of the asparagus are thick, then peel the bottom half of each.
Lay them in a single layer on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Roast for 15 to 20 minutes, until tender.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan and return to the oven for another minute. Serve hot and plain with lemon wedges.

name: Pepperoni Mushroom Pizza
description: This white-hot appetizer for pizza is made divine with pepperoni and mushrooms. Keep the pizza dough warm by getting crisp and serve up a savory treat with other side dishes.
ingredients: 1 cup (4 ounces) shredded mozzarella cheese, divided
directions: Combine the beaten egg and Cheddar cheese. Press into the buttered 12-inch pizza pan or 10-inch pie pan. Bake at 400 °F for 4 minutes.
Combine tomato sauce, basil, garlic powder and oregano. Pour on the tomato sauce mixture by spreading. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Layer ½ cup mozzarella cheese, pepperoni and mushrooms. Top with remaining ½ cup mozzarella cheese and parsley.
Bake at 400 °F for 8 to 10 minutes. Serve warm and plain but cut into serving pieces with the pizza cutter, the cleaver, or the chef's knife.

name: Popcorn Chicken
description: The crispy alternative to the original popcorn, this white-hot, bite-sized appetizer/side dish is made from real chicken and packed with herbs and spices, as it then maintains a savory taste with the poultry.
ingredients: 1 tsp. salt, rock or iodized only
2 tbsp. lemon or lime juice, optional
directions: Cut the chicken breasts into small chunks with the chef's knife.
Sift the flour and mix up the salt, Cajun seasoning, black pepper, garlic powder, and lemon or lime juice (optional).  Dip the chicken in the egg then generously coat in the flour mixture.
Heat the oil in a frying pan. Drop a few drops of batter into the oil and, if it sizzles and fries, then it is ready.
Add chicken to the oil in small batches and turn over to make sure both sides are cooked evenly.
Remove and drain on kitchen paper when golden. Leave to drain a moment or two so the chicken is crunchy.
Sprinkle salt to taste. Serve warm and plain over white rice or with other appetizers or side dishes.

name: Quesarito
description: A red-hot, rich combination of quesadilla and burrito is a remarkable, cheesy dish made as an appetizer and is cooked to an incredible aroma. Heavy cream, leftover cooked beef, fresh chili peppers, and hot sauce work for this, too.
ingredients: 1 3/4 lb. lean ground chuck of beef
directions: In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise (or all-purpose cream), minced jalapeños (or chopped red chili peppers), jalapeño juice (or hot sauce), ¾ teaspoon sugar, ½ teaspoon paprika, ½ teaspoon cumin, ⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper, ⅛ teaspoon garlic powder and a pinch of salt. Mix until well combined and set aside.

In a separate bowl, combine masa corn flour, chili powder, onion powder, ½ teaspoon garlic powder, seasoning salt, ½ teaspoon paprika, ¼ teaspoon cumin, garlic salt, ¼ teaspoon sugar, minced onion, and beef bouillon. Mix well and set aside.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Crumble the ground chuck into the skillet and cook while breaking the meat up into chunks with a spatula until browned.
Drain off any excess grease. Add ¾-1 cup of water and the taco seasoning to the ground beef. Mix well and simmer on medium-low heat for 20 minutes.
Simmer until almost all of the moisture has cooked away.
Melt the butter in a medium saucepan. Add the rice and cook while stirring for 1-2 minutes. Add the chicken broth, salt, pepper, zest and lime juice, cilantro and ¼ teaspoon cumin.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and cook for about 15-16 minutes. Remove from heat and allow the rice to sit covered for an additional 10 minutes.
Lay out a sheet of paper towel onto a microwave safe plate. Add one tortilla on top of the paper towel.
Add a thin layer of cheese on top of the tortillas. Place another tortilla on top of the cheese.
Place a damp paper towel on top.

Place into the microwave and cook for 30 seconds to 1 minute or until the cheese has melted. In the center of the prepared quesadilla, add some of the ground beef, top with some of the cilantro-lime rice.
Add a little bit of the chipotle sauce and sour cream.
Roll up the burritos by folding the corners towards the center and then grabbing the bottom and rolling up. Repeat this process with the remaining tortillas and cheese.
To cook them in the pan, spray a large skillet with cooking spray and heat the skillet to medium-high heat.

Place the wraps into the skillet seam-side down and cook until golden brown and crisp on the bottom; turn over and cook until golden brown on the other side (about 2-3 minutes per side). Serve hot and plain then pair this quesarito with other side dishes or appetizers, if desired.

name: Ramadan Kebab
description: This special Ramadan dish will remind you of Gyros (Döner) with yogurt and is so easy to prepare. You can start making this, 30 minutes before dinner. Use of garlic is one the best ways to make you want to drink water, which restores the liquid in a body from which a fasting person refrains during the day.
ingredients: 1 lb. of ground Beef or Lamb
salt, pepper and red pepper flakes
directions: Cook the onion for a couple of minutes than add the ground meat and salt and black pepper. Stirring often, cook the meat.
Add tomatoes and cook for 5 more minutes. Set these aside; keep the lid on. Mix yogurt with garlic well, with a fork.

Keep it in room temperature. In a saucepan, sauté red pepper flakes in margarine, for 3 minutes. Warm up the bread in the oven for 5 minutes. On each dinner plate, place pita squares and sprinkle it with 2 tbsp. warm water right away; spread the sautéed meat over the bread.
Then spread some garlic yogurt on top. Pour over the sautéed red pepper to garnish. Sprinkle some mint on top. Serve hot.

name: Red Fried Potatoes
description: This red-hot side dish is made with real potatoes and enriched with butter, salt, and pepper to fresh perfection. With heavenly, savory aroma, every chunk is pure potato fun!
ingredients: 2 lbs. small red potatoes, washed and peeled
6 tbsp. butter, reserving 3 tbsp. for seasoning
5 tsp. black pepper, to taste, reserving 3 tsp. if desired
directions: In a heavy skillet, over moderate heat, melt 3 tablespoons of butter with the olive oil.
When the foaming decreases, add the potatoes.
Turning frequently, cook until tender and golden brown. Slice the cooked potatoes into quarters with a kitchen knife.
Transfer the cooked, sliced potatoes to a large bowl then season with the remaining butter, salt, and a little pepper.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve. Garnish with the red pepper flakes and/or the remaining black pepper, if desired.

name: Ruska Salata
description: A great Russian salad, perfect to serve at a party or as a side dish! Explore Main Dish Recipes to find the perfect entree to accompany the salad.
ingredients: 2 hard boiled eggs chopped into squares
salt and lemon juice to taste
directions: Boil the potatoes, carrots, eggs and the peas.
When cooled, mix everything together and let stand for an hour.

name: Salmon and Green Bean Salad
description: This recipe turns a piece of leftover salmon into a satisfying main dish for four. Feel free to substitute dill or chives for the herbs listed.
ingredients: 8 black olives, pitted and coarsely chopped
1 shallot or (¼ small onion, diced, red, white, or yellow only)
12 oz. salmon steak, grilled or broiled
1 roasted red pepper, cut into strips
directions: In a large bowl, combine lemon juice and mustard; whisk until blended.
Add olive oil in a thin, steady stream, whisking constantly until smooth.
Add green beans, tomatoes, shallot, basil and parsley and toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Cut salmon into 1-inch cubes; add to salad.
Toss gently to coat. Arrange greens on serving plates; top with salmon mixture.
Garnish with pepper strips. Serve warm and plain or with any appetizer.

name: Sausage Rolls
description: Similar to the original beef roll-ups or calzone, this sausage-based side dish is made and mixed with shortcrust pastry, flour, and real milk and baked to smooth, golden-brown perfection. Ground or cooked, leftover beef occasionally works for this, too.
ingredients: milk, to glaze, low-fat or regular only
directions: Roll the pastry out thinly into a rectangle, then cut it lengthwise into 2 strips with the chef's knife.
Divide the sausage meat into 2 pieces; dust with flour and form into 2 rolls the length of the pastry.
Lay a roll of sausage meat down the center of each strip; just brush down the edges of the pastry with a little milk.
Fold one side of the pastry over the sausage meat and press the two edges firmly together.
Seal the long edges together by flaking.
Brush the length of the two rolls with milk; then cut each into slices 4 cm (1 inch) to 5 cm (2 inches) long.

Place on a baking sheet and bake in a moderately hot oven (200°C / 400°F / Gas 6) for 15 minutes; to cook the meat thoroughly, reduce the temperature to moderate (180°C / 350°F / Gas 4) and cook for a further 15 minutes.
Cover and brown the top of the dish under a hot grill. Just serve straight from the pan.

name: Smoked Salmon Quinoa Quiche
description: A natural, grainy combination of quinoa, authentic salmon, cheese, milk, eggs, and pesto is made and mixed with salt, pepper, and yogurt and baked to soothing, white-hot perfection. Color, flavor, and quality are usually important, while it also keeps a glorious, bold aroma with the seafood and cheese.
directions: Cook quinoa according to instructions; add the 4 tbsp of basil pesto into the cooked quinoa.
Then add ½ cup of the asiago cheese and mix them well.
Press the quinoa mixture into a 9" pie plate, covering the sides and bottom of pan to create a "crust"; place the crust into a 400° F oven for 15 minutes to set.
Remove from the oven and set aside.
In a medium bowl, add the 4 eggs, ½ cup of milk, the ⅛ tsp. of salt, and ¼ tsp. of pepper.
Beat well. Add one cup of smoked salmon and using a spatula, fold in carefully.
Pour mixture into the prepared "crust" and place in the 400° F oven for 40 minutes.
At that time, add the remaining ½ cup of asiago cheese to the top and return to oven for 20 minutes.
In a small bowl, add the 1 cup of plain yogurt, 2 tbsp. of lemon curd, and 2 tsp. of lemon zest. Mix well and refrigerate until quiche has finished baking.
Allow quiche to sit for 5-7 minutes before serving. Alongside or on top of the quiche, place the lemon yogurt sauce and serve. Garnish with the chili leaves, if desired.

name: Sweet Potato Hash Browns
description: This recipe came from an estate sale. I obtained it when I purchased the family collection from the Mclean Estate in Irving, Texas in 1982.
ingredients: 4 cups peeled coarsely grated sweet potatoes
directions: In a bowl, beat egg yolks lightly and add the grated sweet potato, whiskey, flour, nutmeg, salt, white pepper, brown sugar, and chopped parsley.
Fold together until all of the ingredients are well blended.
Heat butter in a skillet then drop mixture by spoonfuls, keeping to a size of about 4 inches across, and cook gently until browned around the edges.
Flip each cake over and cook for 3 minutes.
Remove the paper bag or newspaper to drain. Serve warm and plain, then pair this homemade, fried hash brown with other side dishes or main dishes, if desired.

name: Swiss Potato Bake
description: Purchased from the Weir Estate in Canton, Texas in 1990. Date on card says 1944.
ingredients: 6 potatoes, peeled and sliced or (10 frozen hash browns)
directions: Preheat an oven to 350° F. Put potatoes (or hash browns) in a 9 x 13-inch baking pan.
Sprinkle potatoes (or hash browns) with salt and pepper.
Cover with the grated cheese and pour cream evenly over the top.
Drizzle with melted butter or margarine.
Bake for 1 ½ hours. Serve hot and plain or with other main dishes, vegetables, or side dishes but transfer the cooked, sliced potatoes (or hash browns) to a large plate.

name: Thai Chicken Meatballs
description: These are tasty little meatballs that are very easy to prepare. You can serve them with a variety of dipping sauces. Great for cocktails and dinner parties or just having snacks.
ingredients: 1/4 cup hot sauce or sweet chili sauce, optional
directions: Mix all ingredients, except oil, cucumber, and chile sauces.
Wet hands, and take one tablespoon of ground chicken mixture and form into a meatball; repeat. Freeze the Thai-style meatballs overnight.
Shallow-fry the meatball with the oil until they are brown and cooked through.
Serve hot and plain or with other dishes. Top with the grated cucumber and lightly drizzle with the hot sauce or sweet chili sauce, if desired.

name: Toasted Pita Chips
description: These are great with dips, soups and in lunches. For more fiber, use whole wheat pita bread. You can also make the pita crisps good for spreading, dipping, or serving plain or with other main dishes, appetizers, or side dishes.
directions: Preheat an oven to 325° F. Split each pita pocket in half.
Cut each half into 6 triangles with a sharp knife.
Arrange in single layers on cookie sheets. Sprinkle lightly with garlic powder, if desired.
Bake for 8 minutes or until chips are lightly browned and very crisp. Store in an airtight container until ready to serve. Pair with a choice of dips, if desired.

name: Yellow Rice with Chickpeas
description: Fruits and Veggies Matter Child Recipe Cards by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, public domain government resource—original source of recipe
ingredients: 1 medium-size onion, white or yellow only, diced
3/4 tsp. salt, rock or iodized only
1 cup canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained
directions: In a fresh 3-quart saucepan over moderate heat, heat oil; add the onion and the potato. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add water, rice, salt, cumin seeds, and turmeric; over high heat, heat to boiling.

Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 20 minutes, or until rice and potatoes are tender. During the last 5 minutes of cooking, just mix with chickpeas. Serve hot and plain but pair this turmeric-based rice dish with other main dishes.

name: Zucchini Gratin
description: A traditional side-dish alternative - you can make this with other vegetables for the gratin served for dinner. Cottage cheese works for this, too, while simply replacing the potatoes.
ingredients: 2 pounds zucchini, sliced in ¼-inch thick rounds, about 4 medium
2 tsp. salt, kosher, rock, or iodized only
1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, 2 oz.
directions: Butter a 10-inch pie plate or quiche pan.
Put the sliced zucchini in a medium pot and cover with water.
Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes; drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking.
Arrange the zucchini in the pie plate in an overlapping circular pattern.
Season with salt and pepper between layers.
Top with Parmesan cheese and drizzle with melted butter.

Bake at 400° F for 30 minutes, then bake at 475° F for another 10 minutes until golden brown. Serve hot and plain or with other vegetables, main dishes, or side dishes but cut into squares with a kitchen knife and place the vegetable-based gratin into a small, fresh plate.

name: Barbados Cherry Ice
description: The key stone-cold ingredients for this beverage are the cherries, water, and sugar. This ice-cold Barbadian beverage is great with other fruits for garnishing and delivers a rich, icy aroma that it relishes. Apple juice sometimes works for this too.
ingredients: sugar, white or brown only, to taste
directions: Squeeze out the seeds from the cherries, which should give about 2 pints of pulp and juice.
Add the water and apple juice (if desired), sweeten to taste, and freeze. Serve cold with other fruits but pour or scoop the contents into a beer mug or a highball glass with ice cubes.

name: Cafe Mocha
description: A River of Recipes: Native American Recipes Using Commodity Foods by the USDA Food Distribution Program on Indian Reservations, public domain government resource—original source of recipe
ingredients: 1/3 cup instant nonfat dry milk + 1 cup water (or 1 cup nonfat milk)
directions: Heat milk in saucepan until warm; do not boil. Add coffee and hot chocolate mix. Stir well and heat to desired temperature.
Divide coffee mixture between two mugs. Top with non-fat whipped topping and cinnamon, if desired.

name: Chocolate Milkshake
description: Got a cold highball or beer mug? This rich chocolate-based beverage is made and packed with ice cream and milk and delivers a stone-cold, divine aroma that it relishes with other desserts.
ingredients: 1/2 cup milk, regular or skimmed/low-fat/reduced fat only
directions: Put 2 scoops of chocolate ice cream into a blender. Add with milk.
Blend the milk and ice cream together and serve immediately. Top with the whipped cream.

name: Fizzy Pomegranate Water
description: This is a great drink to quench your thirst! Fizzy Pomegranate Water is sweet and bubbly!
directions: Fill 4 Cups with 4 ice cubes each.
Add 1 Tablespoon of pomegranate juice.
Fill the Remainder of the glasses with seltzer water.
Garnish with lime wedges (and straws) and serve.

name: Fortified Milk
description: Fortified Milk from Recipes for Better Nutrition During Cancer Treatment by the National Cancer Institute, public domain government resource—original source of recipe
directions: Pour liquid milk into deep bowl. Add dry milk and beat slowly with beater until dry milk is dissolved (usually less than 5 minutes).
Refrigerate. The flavor improves after several hours.

name: Irish Coffee Supreme
description: Made with real coffee, Irish whiskey, and heavy cream, this fresh, soothing beverage is great for breakfast or dessert and delivers a brown, foamy aroma that it regularly relishes and enhances with brown sugar and alcohol content.
directions: Fill the large glass with hot water to preheat, then empty.
Pour piping hot coffee into the warmed glass until it is about ½ full.
Add 1 tablespoon brown sugar and stir until completely dissolved. Just blend in Irish whiskey.
Gently top with a collar of slightly whipped heavy cream by pouring gently over a spoon.
Color with crème de menthe and enjoy while piping hot. Serve warm and plain with other desserts, appetizers, or side dishes.

name: Lager and Lemon-Limeade
description: Similar to the classic lager, this tangy alcohol-based beverage is made and mixed with lemonade and real fruit juice and keeps a stone-cold aroma with the alcohol content. Lemon zest occasionally replaces the lemon wedge and works for this for garnishing, too.
ingredients: 6 tbsp. sweetened lime juice or syrup
directions: Stir together all ingredients.
Add ice, if desired, and serve in a beer mug or a highball with a floating lime wedge as a garnish.

name: Laura Bush's Hot Chocolate
description: Regardless of political orientation, everyone likes hot chocolate, right?
directions: Mix cocoa, salt, and sugar.
Add milk.
Heat to dissolve.
Add light cream, cinnamon, vanilla.
Heat to just under boiling.
Mix very well and pour into warm mug.
Top with whipped cream, cocoa powder, and fine orange zest.

name: Pineapple Fizz
description: Pineapple juice and light rum are mixed with club soda for extra powerful taste. Lime or lemon zest sometimes works for this for garnishing, too.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp. powdered sugar or white sugar
sliced lemon or lime zest, optional
directions: Pour pineapple juice, shake with ice, and strain into glass ¼ full of ice cubes.
Fill with club soda, pineapple syrup (optional), and light rum and stir gently. Pour into beer mugs or other glasses.
Serve cold and plain or with other fruits or appetizers. Top with the lemon zest and/or pineapple syrup, if desired.

name: Vaifala
description: A refreshing and light drink, perfect for summer.
ingredients: 1/2 of a 567 g (20 oz) can of pineapple (chunks/slices/crushed)
1/2 of a 400 g (14 oz) can of sweetened condensed milk
directions: If you're not using crushed pineapple, then drain and chop the pineapple. Reserve the drained syrup. If you're using any other fruit, drain (reserving syrup) and chop those too.
Place the fruit and about half the fruit syrup in large bottle or bowl.
Pour in the sweetened condensed milk and water, then mix.
Add sugar to taste (I use about 2 tablespoons).
Chill well, or if serving immediately, throw in some ice.
Before serving, stir well, because the pineapple has a tendency to settle, then pour into a large glass and serve with a spoon (this is a drink that you both drink and eat).

name: Artichoke Lemon Pasta
description: This is a great spring dinner dish. I like to serve it cold on a warm day but its great warm too. Also, its healthy and simple!
ingredients: Angel hair pasta, four servings according to box
directions: Boil artichokes according to packaging
Drain and chop artichoke hearts
Cut asparagus into two inch pieces
Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a medium sauce pan
Add garlic, salt and pepper to the oil. Heat for 1 minute.
Add the asparagus and cook for five minutes over medium heat
Add artichokes and squeeze half a lemon into the pan
Drain pasta saving a few tablespoons of the pasta water (to thicken sauce)
Place pasta and remaining water into the sauce pan, stir with veggies
Add the remaining two tablespoons of olive oil and salt and pepper to taste
Take of heat and garnish with shaved Parmesan and lemon zest.

name: Asparagus Soup with Green Garlic and Eggs
description: This is a beautiful high protein, light spring soup.
ingredients: 5 cups chicken stock, vegetable stock, or water
1 bulb green garlic, separated into cloves if cloves have formed, peeled and thinly sliced
1/4 cup freshly grated pecorino or Parmesan cheese
1/2 cup pasta or rice, cooked, or 4 to 6 slices toasted Italian bread (optional)
directions: Break off the woody ends of the asparagus stalks and combine them with the stock or water and the garlic in a soup pot and bring to a simmer. Simmer 15 minutes. Using a skimmer, tongs, or a slotted spoon, remove the asparagus stems and discard.

Season the broth to taste with salt and pepper. Slice the asparagus into 1-inch pieces and add to the broth. Simmer 8 to 12 to minutes. It should be very tender and fragrant, but still bright green and not mushy.

Just before serving, beat the eggs, cheese, and parsley together in a bowl. Have the soup at a bare simmer. Making sure that the soup isn't boiling, whisk a ladleful into the egg mixture. Stir well and whisk back into the soup. Whisk constantly over very low heat for 3 minutes, then ladle into bowls and serve, with a spoonful of pasta or rice, or a slice of toast in each bowl if desired.
This soup must be served right away.

name: Crab Deli Loaf
description: Tired of gloppy, unappetizing seafood salads? This refreshing dish uses healthy Greek yogurt as the binder and the punch of assorted fresh herbs packs a lot of flavor. Serve as a light lunch along with sides of your choice.
ingredients: Fresh basil, flat leaf parsley and dill, chopped
1 fresh red chili, seeded and chopped
4 tbsp. Rachel’s Greek Style Natural Bio Live Yogurt
directions: Begin by chopping the herbs finely; to cut down time use a mini chopper or food processor. Place in a bowl.
Add the chili, lemon juice and lemon zest. Mix well.
Now add the crab and stir in the yogurt and mix again until you have a spreadable consistency. Season with salt & pepper.
Slice the baguette with a serrated knife and drizzle with a little olive oil.
Arrange the rocket (arugula) leaves onto the bread and then spread over the crab filling. Add the cherry tomatoes. Serve immediately.

name: Easy Pizza
description: Makes 4 servings
ingredients: 1¼ oz. package gluten-free quick rise yeast
directions: Combine flour, yeast, salt and xanthan gum in large bowl.
Stir in 1 cup water, olive oil and honey.
Use hands to work dough (dough will be soft and crumbly).
Add just enough of remaining ¼ cup water to hold mixture together.
Knead dough in bowl 5 minutes.
Cover; let rest 10 minutes.
Lightly grease 12-inch pizza pan; sprinkle with cornmeal, if desired.
Flatten dough into round disk; press dough into pan.
Add sauce, desired toppings; sprinkle cheese over toppings.
Bake in 425°F oven 20 to 30 minutes, or until crust is brown and cheese is melted.
Timing varies according to amount and number of toppings.
Use sharp knife or pizza wheel to cut into wedges.

name: Gluten-Free Fried Fish and Chips
description: Just because you're gluten-free doesn't mean you have to miss out on all the fun! Crispy and savory, this fried fish will make you question why you ever used regular flour in the first place!
ingredients: 2 lbs fish fillet (any white fish, but cod is more authentic)
directions: Gently rinse the fish in cold water. Pat fillets dry with paper towel (note: if you have large fillets, cut the fish into smaller pieces).
Mix dry ingredients in a large bowl. Mix beer and eggs separately and stir in dry ingredients. Blend ingredients until mixture is smooth.
Place fish fillets in batter mixture, making sure to coat the fillets evenly on both sides.

Heat oil to 350°F. Gently place small batches of fish in oil so that the oil’s temperature does not drop. Fry fillets for 5–8 minutes, or until they are golden brown on both sides. Be sure to turn the fillets frequently to prevent scorching the batter.
Remove fish to paper towels to drain excess oil.
Serve with hot fries.

name: Healthy Waffles by Pce3@ij.net
description: The amount of each ingredient was determined using the Diet Plan Calculator, which prescribed a 20% fat, 65% carbs and 15% protein diet plan for the author from the author's desired and existing body measurements.
directions: Mix dry ingredients thoroughly in shaker jar.
Relocate to small mixing bowl.
Add oil and let soak in while iron is preheating.
Add  water and blend with a hand mixer on low.
Pour batter into waffle iron with help of silicon spatula.
Cook until brown but avoid burning.
Use lower heat setting and longer cook time for dryer waffle.

name: Italian Style Gulyás
description: This dish is a take on what Americans view as gulyás (goulash). Gulyás is a beloved, traditional Hungarian dish and is typically a version of a thick stew; there are many versions of gulyás - most of them are beef-based and feature a rich, paprika-laden sauce. This recipe is a combination of some Italian-inspired ingredients but is in the same spirit of a gulyás - it warms the body and the soul.
ingredients: 1 lb. lean ground turkey  (Replacing the turkey with green lentils or perhaps other Italien style pulses would probably work for a vegetarian dish, that won't be an authentic Gulyás but it will be atypical Italien style pasta and lentil dish.  Use less than 1 lb. Boil the pulses separately.)
1 green bell pepper, diced or sliced thinly
1 large zucchini (courgette), cut in thin coins (about 1/8 - 1/4" thick; use a mandoline for consistency)
1 (14 oz.) can no salt added diced tomatoes, with juice
8 oz. gemelli or elbow pasta** (about 3 cups dried pasta)
2/3 cup Pecorino Romano/Parmesan cheese blend, grated, plus more for serving
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
directions: In a large skillet, brown the meat over medium heat. Remove the meat, drain away any grease, and wipe out the pan. (Omit this for the vegetarian version.)

Sauté the onion and green bell pepper in 2 tbsp. extra virgin olive oil over medium-low heat until tender. Add the garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add the zucchini, season with salt, pepper and the herbs.  Sauté until the zucchini starts to soften around the edges. Add the meat back in. (For the vegetarian version add cooked lentils or other pulses round about this point instead of meat.) Add the tomatoes, then mix well, cover and let simmer for 15 - 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the pasta until al dente in a large pot of salted boiling water according to package directions.

In a large pasta bowl (or the pot in which the pasta was cooked), toss the pasta, meat mixture and cheese together. Serve immediately with crusty Italian bread and extra cheese for sprinkling over the top.

name: John Dory with Fried Fennel
description: Change up your dinner routine with this mouth-watering dish! The buttery flavor of John Dory, coupled with the unique flavor of fennel makes for quite the gastronomic experience!
ingredients: 1/4 cup (½ stick) chilled butter, cut into pieces
(4) 7-ounce John Dory or sea bass fillets
directions: Brush john dory with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Heat large skillet over medium-high heat until hot.
Add fish and cook 3 minutes per side or until the center becomes opaque.
Transfer fish to platter; tent with foil to keep warm. Remove excess oil from skillet.
Add wine and anchovies and boil for 12 minutes or until mixture is reduced to ⅓ cup.
Add butter and whisk until mixture is melted and smooth. Season with pepper to taste.
Arrange fried fennel in center of plates.
Place fish on top of fried fennel and add sauce. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

name: Low Fat Ricotta Spinach Rolls
description: Delicious, low fat, Italian dish. Very filling too!
ingredients: 16 oz. low-fat ricotta cheese or fat-free ricotta cheese
1 box chopped frozen spinach, drained well
16 oz. pasta sauce (homemade or store bought)
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Start chopping basil and parsley.
(use dried if you really feel lazy!) prepare lasagna pasta according to package lay a few sheets of wax paper on the kitchen table.
In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta, ½ of the mozzarella (reserve rest for later), parsley, basil, spinach (hopefully you really squeezed it out dry!) , salt, pepper, egg and carrots. Mix well by hand.
Lay cooked lasagna on wax paper spread a thin layer of spinach mixture down the length of the lasagna.
You may have leftover pasta and/or spinach filling.
Just store it or chuck it.
Spread a little sauce on the bottom of large shallow casserole dish.
Roll each filled lasagna and place in casserole dish.
Spoon the pasta sauce onto spinach rolls.
Top with remaining mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 20 – 30 minutes.
Serve hot with a crusty garlic bread and salad.

name: Low Fat Zucchini Frittata
description: A very good low fat frittata, you can use or include other veggies or substitute other veggies for the zucchini, A good appetizer or entree.
ingredients: 1 cup cooked white rice (a good use for leftover rice)
1 cup egg substitute or egg whites
directions: Clean and slice the zucchini in half, lengthwise, then into 1/8-inch pieces.
Dice onion and mince garlic (use as much as you like) Saute zucchini, onions and garlic in 2 tablespoons olive oil until onions and zucchini are limp.
salt and pepper to taste.
Mix rice, Parmesan, grated mozzarella and eggs in a bowl.
Stir in saute of zucchini, onion and the rest, salt and pepper to taste, Mix all ingredients well.
Heat 9x12-inch nonstick fry pan between medium and medium-high heat, and add 2 to 3 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil.
When pan is hot, pour contents of mixing bowl into fry pan, spread mixture evenly around pan, making sure that the rice and veggies are spread through the liquid.
When the frittata is brown on the bottom, use a plate to turn it over.
Cook until both sides are brown and firm.
Slice and serve, It can be eaten hot or cold as an appetizer, slice into 1-inch cubes or if sliced larger, as an entrée.

name: Malaysian Spicy Noodle Soup
description: Recipe by Hooked on Heat
ingredients: 1/2 cup fried pieces of chicken or tofu
directions: Soak noodles in a bowl of hot water for 5 minutes and set aside.
Add ginger, garlic, red chilies, basil and lemon grass to chicken stock and bring to a boil.
Strain the soup and add to noodles.

name: Meatless Monday: Rice and Beans
description: Quick and easy Meatless Monday recipe, inspired by on Veg's post
directions: First, prepare brown rice
Dice tomatoes, onions and slice mushrooms
Drizzle olive oil into a cast iron skillet (while the rice is cooking separately) and throw in the veggies and the black beans.
Sprinkle in some cumin, chili pepper, cayenne pepper, crushed red pepper flakes, a pinch of salt and squirt of agave (optional).
Add spinach last
Allow veggies to simmer on low until rice is complete.
Stir the cooked rice into the veggie medley
Top the dish off with big slices of avocado.

name: Pan-Fried John Dory
description: To experience John Dory is something you won't soon forget. Mild, sweet, and flavorful, this delicate fish will melt in your mouth and leave you pondering why you didn't try it sooner.
ingredients: 3½ cups fresh breadcrumbs made from (crustless) Italian bread
directions: Preheat oven to 250°F.
In a shallow dish, whisk eggs with ¾ teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper.
Place flour on a plate and place breadcrumbs on another plate.
Dredge fish in flour, making sure to shake off excess.
Dip fish into seasoned eggs and coat with breadcrumbs.
Transfer fillets to baking sheet.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Gently place 2 fillets into the oil and cook for 3 minutes on each side.
Coating should be golden brown and fillets should be opaque in the center.
Transfer fillets to baking sheet and place them in the oven to keep them warm.
Repeat until all fish has been cooked.
Garnish with lemon wedges and serve.

name: Potato Pancakes by Pce3@ij.net
description: Potato pancake batter meals are great the end of the season when you are running out of supplies at the cabin
directions: Weight potato flakes and oatmeal and use blender to mill into a powder.
Blend in a mixing or serving bowl with peanut butter and water until the consistency of a batter that can be spooned (thick) or poured (thin) onto a waffle iron, flat grill top or a frying pan.
Fry just as you would a standard waffle or pancake.

name: Salmon Risotto with Cucumber
description: Deliciously creamy, this risotto is accented with the flavors of fresh tarragon and cucumber, both of which complement the flavor of salmon well. Use Arborio or Carnaroli rice. Add some salt at the end.
ingredients: 1 small bunch scallions, white part only, chopped
1 lb. salmon fillet, skinned and diced
directions: Heat the margarine in a large saucepan, and add the scallions and cucumber. Cook for about 2 - 3 minutes without coloring.
Add the rice, broth and wine and return to a boil.
Simmer the wine and broth mixture for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the diced salmon and tarragon.
Continue cooking for 5 minutes more, then switch off the heat. Cover and leave to stand for 5 minutes before serving.

name: Simple Veggie Chili
description: Donna says: If you haven’t tried Anne’s ULTIMATE VEGGIE CHILI recipe, put this on your “Must Try” list. It is easily the best veggie chili I have ever eaten. It has a fabulous rich, smoky flavor and texture and is very frugal. It is packed with budget-friendly healthy protein in the form of beans and tofu.
ingredients: 1 tsp. each chipotle chili powder and crushed red pepper flakes
14 oz. extra-firm tofu, frozen and thawed, excess water squeezed out [2]
2 (14 oz.) cans black beans, drained and rinsed
1 (14 oz.) can dark kidney beans, drained and rinsed
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: In a large stockpot, sauté onion, bell pepper, and garlic in the olive oil over medium-high heat until onions are starting to soften. Stir in cumin, chipotle, and red pepper flakes. Crumble the thawed tofu into the mixture and sauté 5 minutes more.

Reduce heat to medium. Add all tomatoes, jalapenos, green chiles, black beans, kidney beans, corn and cashews; mix well. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Add salt and pepper, to taste.

As the recipe stands, it’s an effortlessly vegan recipe. I personally prefer to add a little sour cream and grated sharp cheddar, but it stands alone perfectly well too, or you could use a vegan sour cream and/or cheese.

name: Spicy Summer Squash Casserole
description: Chiles and cheese turn the summer squash into a satisfying, zesty casserole. The jalapenos make this dish a bit on the spicy/or hot side, but if your preference is for a milder version, substitute with 2 cans of diced green chiles instead.
ingredients: 2 1/4 pounds summer squash, quartered lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise (about 10 cups)
2 1/4 cups grated extra-sharp Cheddar cheese, (about 7 ounces), divided
1/4 cup finely chopped red onion, for garnish
directions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Coat a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Combine squash, onion, chiles, jalapenos, salt and 3/4 cup cheese in a large bowl.
Sprinkle with flour; toss to coat. #Spread the mixture in the prepared baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake the casserole until it is bubbling and the squash is tender, 35 to 45 minutes.
Spoon salsa over the casserole and sprinkle with the remaining 1 1/2 cups cheese.
Bake, uncovered, until golden and heated through, 20 to 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with scallions and red onion.

name: Stovetop BBQ Brisket
description: This recipe is great all year round, but especially in the winter. Brisket is generally a tougher cut of meat, but preparing it this way makes it fall-apart in your mouth tender. It's also a great recipe to experiment with, using different amounts types of condiments and ingredients in the simmer sauce. Diced tomatoes with jalapeños or 3 teaspoons of hot sauce were not used. Additional salt was omitted into the recipe.
ingredients: 1 (3 lbs) beef brisket (trimmed of any excess fat)
3 garlic (chopped) or 1 tbsp. bottle chopped garlic
3 carrots (sliced) or bag of mini carrots whole
small red or white potatoes whole
directions: Pat brisket dry and sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat in a dutch oven or braising pot. Sear the brisket until it is browned (4 to 5 mins per side). Then transfer brisket to a plate.
Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the pot and cook the onions, stirring a few times, until softened (3 to 5 mins).
Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 min. Return meat to the pot.
Add diced tomatoes, broth, brown sugar, barbecue sauce, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, and all other ingredients. Bring mixture to a low boil then turn down heat to low.
Spoon liquid mixture over the brisket (if needed) and cover tightly.
Some people like to transfer brisket to an oven at 300 degrees, but for this recipe i prefer to cook it on the stove top until done.
Cook brisket until it is fork tender (2½ to 3 hrs). It is like a tasty pot roast when made this way.
Remove brisket from oven or pot and transfer meat to a cutting board. Let rest for 10 to 20 mins.. before slicing.

name: Sweet and Sour Chicken Drumsticks
description: These chicken drumsticks stay moist when grilled, even with the skin removed from them. Delicious served with brown rice and slices of fresh pineapple.
ingredients: 1 tbsp. plus 1 tsp. cider vinegar, divided
8 chicken drumsticks, (about 2 pounds), skin removed, trimmed
directions: Preheat grill to medium.
To prepare dipping sauce, combine orange zest, orange juice, water, honey, 1 tablespoon vinegar, 1/4 teaspoon salt and coriander in a small saucepan; bring to a boil.
Whisk cornstarch and the remaining 1 teaspoon vinegar in a small bowl until smooth.
Add to the saucepan and return to a boil, whisking until thickened, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Stir in mint.
Sprinkle drumsticks with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper.
Oil the grill rack.
Grill the drumsticks until crispy on all sides and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part registers 165°F, about 15 minutes total.
Serve the drumsticks with the dipping sauce on the side.

name: Tahu Taugé
description: A crispy Indonesian salad with tofu, cucumber and beansprouts. This is my favourite salad!
ingredients: 2 tsp.. sweet red pepper sauce or 1 tsp.. sambal oelek
directions: Cut the tofu in ½ inch (1.5 cm) thick slices.
Heat 4 tbsp of oil and bake the tofu slices golden on both sides in about 6 minutes.
Cool down and cut into squares.
Bake the onion in oil in 5 – 10 minutes.
Slice the cucumber thinly, sprinkle on some salt, put in a colander and cover with a weighed down plate.
After 30 minutes rinse the cucumber, and let the water drip of.
Put the beansprouts in a colander, and pour boiling water over them, let the excess drip off.
Put the ginger, garlic, ground coriander, pepper/sambal and sugar in a pestle and mortar, and ground to a paste.
Add vinegar and soy sauce and stir it to a nice sauce.
Make individual plates (4 – 6) or one big platter.
Put tofu on the plate, and on top of that cucumber and beansprouts.
Drizzle the sauce over.
Sprinkle fried onions and chopped coriander leaves on top.

name: Teriyaki Pork Chops with a Blueberry and Ginger Relish
description: Tender, delectable, pork chops with a sweet ginger relish.
directions: Place pork chops in a large sealable plastic bag.
Whisk soy sauce, sherry, garlic, brown sugar and crushed red pepper in a small bowl.
Add the marinade to the bag, seal and turn to coat.
Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight.

name: Turkey à la King
description: This is a great family meal. It's quick and filling:)
directions: In a large skillet over medium low heat, cook butter until golden brown.
Saute mushrooms until tender.
Stir in flour until smooth.
Slowly whisk in chicken broth, and cook until slightly thickened.
Stir in cream, turkey and peas.
Reduce heat to low, and cook until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper.

name: Artichoke Dip
description: This is a healthy artichoke dip that is a nice change from the fattening dips you usually see at parties! You can serve it with whole wheat crackers or pita chips.
ingredients: ⅛ tsp. freshly ground black pepper
directions: Preheat oven to 400° F.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
Mix until well combined.
Transfer to a medium heat-proof dish.
Bake 20-25 minutes until the top of the dip begins to brown.

name: Asian-style Crab Cakes
description: Delicate and tasty, these little crab cakes can be served as a simple supper or as an appetizer for eight people.  Using a mixture of white and brown crab meat ensures a depth of flavor and texture.  Serve with sweet chili sauce for dipping.
ingredients: 2⅔ cups fresh crab meat, white and brown
directions: Put the crab meat in a bowl and add the ginger, some salt and ground black pepper and the flour. Stir well until thoroughly mixed.
Using floured hands, divide the mixture into 16 equal sized pieces and shape roughly into patties.
Heat the sunflower oil in a frying pan and add the patties, four at a time. Cook for 2 - 3 minutes on each side, until golden.
Remove with a metal spatula and leave to drain on paper towels for a few minutes.
Keep the cooked crab cakes warm while you cook the remaining patties in the same way.
Serve immediately.

name: Baba Ghannooj
description: Cooked Eggplant Appetizer
directions: Peel the eggplant, and bake or steam till tender. (A user suggested alternatively, "Broil the  eggplant until skin blackened on all sides; cool; peel" I haven't tried the recipe.)
Mash in a bowl with a spoon.
Mix in the sesame oil, lemon juice, salt and garlic, and beat until as smooth as possible.
Mound on a plate or in a shallow dish
Pour the olive oil on top
Sprinkle with parsley.

name: Deviled Eggs II
description: Deviled eggs are a huge potluck favorite. This adapted deviled egg recipe replaces some of the egg yolks with nonfat cottage cheese—keeping the filling velvety and rich while taking away some of the fat. You will be suprised that no one will know the difference.
ingredients: 3 tbsp. minced fresh chives , or scallion greens
directions: Halve eggs lengthwise with a sharp knife. Gently remove the yolks.
Place the yolks in a food processor, or beat with a mixer until smooth.
Add cottage cheese, mayonnaise, chives (or scallion greens), relish, mustard and salt; process/blend until smooth.
Spoon about 2 teaspoons yolk mixture into each egg white half. Sprinkle with paprika, if desired.

name: Grilled Artichokes
description: I love serving this simple recipe at bbqs and for outdoor dinner parties. You can boil the artichokes ahead of time to keep it simple!
ingredients: Capers and orange zest for garnish
directions: Cut stems of artichokes so they are 1 inch from the base, you can also use scissors to cut of the thorns (personally I think its fine to leave them unless you have young kids)
Boil 5 cups of water in a very large pot
Once the water is boiling place the artichokes and two cloves of peeled garlic in the pot
Boil for 25 minutes, rotating artichokes occasionally
Remove and drain the artichokes
Once they are cool enough to handle, cut the artichokes in half
Brush with olive oil and place on grill.
Place cut side down, grill over a medium flame for about 10 minutes
Remove artichokes and garnish with orange zest and capers, serve with a mayo or garlic butter dipping sauce

name: Red Cabbage Quinoa & Goat Cheese Wraps
description: I picked some fresh cabbage from a family garden and wanted to do something unique with it so I came up with the idea of stuffing them with red quinoa and goat cheese. The flavors of this dish blend together so well and the colors are beautiful!
directions: Bring large pot of water to boil and place whole cab­bage in the pot. Cover and let sim­mer for about 10 min­utes or until outer leaves eas­ily come off. After 10 min­utes, use a pair of tongs to remove as many of the soft­ened cab­bage leaves as you can until they start to show resis­tance. Place leaves aside and let the rest of the cab­bage con­tinue to sim­mer for another 10 min­utes. Con­tinue until you have desired num­ber of leaves (1 leaf can be split down the mid­dle to form two wraps).

While cab­bage is boil­ing, cook red quinoa accord­ing to direc­tions on the box. Once quinoa is close to being ready, place olive oil and shal­lots on small pan on medium to high heat and let sim­mer until shal­lots become translu­cent (about 5 min­utes). When quinoa is fin­ished cook­ing, mix in shal­lots and olive oil.

Place wraps on plate or cut­ting board and fill with a few crum­bles of goat cheese (about 2 tsp.) and a spoon­ful of quinoa. Fill­ing should be placed closer to the bot­tom of the wrap for eas­ier rolling. Start­ing from the bot­tom, roll cab­bage into small wrap. In a small bowl, mix together agave or honey and bal­samic vine­gar and driz­zle on top of wrap (or on top of fill­ing if you prefer).

name: Stuffed Mushrooms with Tomatoes and Olives
description: Portobello mushroom caps make delicious miniature casseroles. In this stuffed mushroom twist it has tomato, cheese and olive stuffing that grills up perfectly to satifsy your taste buds. Serve with a healthy green salad for a delicious meal.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp. finely chopped fresh rosemary, or 1/8 tsp. dried
directions: Combine tomatoes, cheese, olives, garlic, 1 teaspoon oil, rosemary and pepper in a small bowl.
Preheat grill to medium.
Discard mushroom stems. Remove brown gills from the undersides of the caps using a spoon; discard gills. Mix the remaining 1 teaspoon oil, lemon juice and soy sauce in a small bowl.
Brush the mixture over both sides of the caps.
Oil a grill rack. Place the caps on the rack, stem sides down, cover and grill until soft, about 5 minutes per side. Remove from the grill and fill with the tomato mixture.
Return to the grill, cover, and cook until the cheese is melted, about 3 minutes more.

name: Tzatziki
description: Tzatziki is a Greek cucumber salad dressed with yogurt, mint and garlic. It is typically served with grilled lamb and chicken but is also good served with crudités.
ingredients: 3 tbsp. finely chopped fresh mint, plus a few sprigs for garnish
directions: Peel the cucumber. Reserve a little of the cucumber to use as a garnish if desired and cut the rest in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds with a teaspoon and discard.
Slice the cucumber thinly and combine with salt. Let stand for 15 - 20 minutes. Salt will soften the cucumber and draw out any bitter juices.
Combine the mint, garlic, sugar and yogurt in a bowl, reserving a few sprigs of mint as a decoration.
Rinse the cucumber in a sieve under cold running water to remove the salt. Drain well and combine with the yogurt. Decorate with a cucumber flower and/or mint. Serve cold.

name: Athenian Pasta Primavera
description: This is a Greek-inspired pasta dish features zucchini, bell pepper, peas, fresh mint and feta. Cherry tomatoes and chopped kalamata olives also work well, along with shredded italian cheese to top it off.
ingredients: 2 tsp. plus 1 tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil, divided
1 medium zucchini, trimmed, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced
1 1/2 cups baby peas, (if frozen, rinse under warm water and drain)
1/2 cup packed fresh mint leaves, chopped
directions: Put a large pot of water on to boil.
Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is beginning to brown, 3 to 5 minutes.

Add bell pepper and zucchini to the onion. Cook, stirring, until the vegetables are just beginning to soften, 3 minutes. Stir in garlic and continue cooking until fragrant, 1 minute more. Stir in wine and pepper; simmer until most of the wine has evaporated, 1 to 2 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook penne in the boiling water according to the package directions, until al dente. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid. Return the pasta to the pot.
Stir the reserved cooking liquid and the vegetables into the pasta along with the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, peas, mint and feta.

name: Baba Ganoush
description: Baba ganoush is a common Middle Eastern and Mediterranean dip with a creamy, somewhat smoky flavor. It is usually eaten with pita bread although naan or a crispy flatbread also work well.
ingredients: 1 medium-large eggplant, any variety, 1 to 1½ pounds
paprika or cayenne pepper, as a garnish
directions: Season the eggplant with ¼ teaspoon of salt.

Roast the eggplant. This can be done in a variety of ways, but the flesh should be fully cooked and the skin should be burned and falling off easily. An effective method is to prick the eggplant and place it a few inches under a broiler, turning it as the exposed skin blackens, about every 3–4 minutes. Place a pan underneath to catch the juices, and discard them.
Scrape off the eggplant skin.
It's all right if you miss a few burned bits.
Finely chop or blend the eggplant flesh with the rest of the ingredients.
The consistency should be smooth.
Reserve a bit of the olive oil, and drizzle that over the top.
Sprinkle with some paprika or cayenne.
If using cayenne, sprinkle sparingly.

name: Deviled Eggs II
description: Deviled eggs are a huge potluck favorite. This adapted deviled egg recipe replaces some of the egg yolks with nonfat cottage cheese—keeping the filling velvety and rich while taking away some of the fat. You will be suprised that no one will know the difference.
ingredients: 3 tbsp. minced fresh chives , or scallion greens
directions: Halve eggs lengthwise with a sharp knife. Gently remove the yolks.
Place the yolks in a food processor, or beat with a mixer until smooth.
Add cottage cheese, mayonnaise, chives (or scallion greens), relish, mustard and salt; process/blend until smooth.
Spoon about 2 teaspoons yolk mixture into each egg white half. Sprinkle with paprika, if desired.

name: Green Beans and Almonds
description: Put a new twist on the classic green bean with richly sautéed onions and almonds.
ingredients: 1 package thawed cut green beans (fresh works too)
directions: In a medium sauce pan, boil green beans. Drain and set aside.
In a medium-sized frying pan, add olive oil and set on medium heat. Add onions and slivered almonds. Sauté for 5-6 minutes.
Pour onions and almonds over green beans. Dash with a bit of salt and pepper if needed.
Serve.

name: Grilled Artichokes
description: I love serving this simple recipe at bbqs and for outdoor dinner parties. You can boil the artichokes ahead of time to keep it simple!
ingredients: Capers and orange zest for garnish
directions: Cut stems of artichokes so they are 1 inch from the base, you can also use scissors to cut of the thorns (personally I think its fine to leave them unless you have young kids)
Boil 5 cups of water in a very large pot
Once the water is boiling place the artichokes and two cloves of peeled garlic in the pot
Boil for 25 minutes, rotating artichokes occasionally
Remove and drain the artichokes
Once they are cool enough to handle, cut the artichokes in half
Brush with olive oil and place on grill.
Place cut side down, grill over a medium flame for about 10 minutes
Remove artichokes and garnish with orange zest and capers, serve with a mayo or garlic butter dipping sauce

name: Low Fat Pesto
description: Can be used on pasta, salads or spread on sandwiches.
ingredients: 1/4 cup freshly grated parmesan or romano cheese (can use soy or lowfat)
2 tbsp. chicken broth (can use veggie broth if preferred)
directions: Place all ingredients in a food processor.
Blend to taste (can be smooth or more chopped).
Refrigerate or freeze until ready to use.

name: Mashed Sweet Potatoes
description: These are a nice alternative to the standard mashed potatoes. Add a little sugar or syrup if you want to eat them as a dessert! (Sweetners may also work, I haven't tried it.) It's ok to use a potato masher if you want to do it the old-fashioned way.
ingredients: 3/4 cup milk  (Vegans may try substituting soy milk or other milk alternatives, I haven't tried it.)
1/2 cup butter {Other fats probably also work, I haven't tried it.)
directions: Boil a large pot of salted water.
Add potatoes and cook for 20 to 30 minutes, or until tender.
Using an electric mixer, blend potatoes, slowly adding ¼ cup of milk at a time.
Continue blending potatoes, adding in cinnamon, salt and pepper.
Blend until you receive your desired texture (smooth or lumpy).
Add butter and serve.

name: Mashed Sweet Potatoes (dairy free)
description: For (Vegans, those with dairy allergies or who are lactose intolerant, here is an alternate recipe to try. I made this recipe for Thanksgiving and my family thought it was as tasty as the kind with milk and butter.
ingredients: 8 medium or 4 large sweet potatoes or yams, peeled and cubed
3/4 cup soy milk (or other non-dairy milk)
1/4 cup brown sugar (Sweetners may also work, I haven't tried it.)

A sweet apple or sweet banana, even Peach  or nectarine cooked with the sweet potatoes may work, Fruit that's getting a bit wilted and not ideal for dessert can frequently be used in this type or recipe. I haven't tried this specific recipe.)
directions: Boil a large pot of water.
Add potatoes and cook for 20 to 30 minutes, or until tender.
If using fruit in place of sugar add it later as fruit takes less time to cook.
Drain potatoes using a colander,
Using an electric mixer (or hand masher, if you prefer), blend potatoes slowly adding ¼ cup of milk alternative at a time until you get to your desired consistency.
Continue blending potatoes, adding in brown sugar and salt.
Blend until at your desired texture (smooth or lumpy).
Serve!

name: Skillet Grilled French Green Beans
description: Great side dish for any meal
directions: Turn the heat to High and throw in 5 slices of garlic.
Once the pan is hot and you see the garlic starting to turn light golden brown, start laying the French green beans to cover the entire pan. Let it sit for 1.5 minutes
Then flip each one over and cook for another 1.5 minutes
Remove from the pan and sprinkle a pinch of salt over the French green beans.
Clean out the pan and repeat steps 1 - 4
Enjoy!

name: Spicy Summer Squash Casserole
description: Chiles and cheese turn the summer squash into a satisfying, zesty casserole. The jalapenos make this dish a bit on the spicy/or hot side, but if your preference is for a milder version, substitute with 2 cans of diced green chiles instead.
ingredients: 2 1/4 pounds summer squash, quartered lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise (about 10 cups)
2 1/4 cups grated extra-sharp Cheddar cheese, (about 7 ounces), divided
1/4 cup finely chopped red onion, for garnish
directions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Coat a 9-by-13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Combine squash, onion, chiles, jalapenos, salt and 3/4 cup cheese in a large bowl.
Sprinkle with flour; toss to coat. #Spread the mixture in the prepared baking dish and cover with foil.
Bake the casserole until it is bubbling and the squash is tender, 35 to 45 minutes.
Spoon salsa over the casserole and sprinkle with the remaining 1 1/2 cups cheese.
Bake, uncovered, until golden and heated through, 20 to 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with scallions and red onion.

name: Spinach & Strawberry Salad
description: This is one of my favorite salads to make during the summer!
ingredients: 1 pint fresh strawberries, washed and hulled
directions: Wash spinach and lay on paper towel to dry.
In a chilled salad bowl, add spinach and strawberries.
Pour Italian dressing over the salad; mix with salad tongs.
Garnish with slivered almonds and serve.

name: Spinach-Watercress Soup
description: This is a light soup suitable as a starter or light meal, like lunch.
ingredients: 500 g of spinach or 300 g of watercress
1 tbsp. of crunchy peanut butter (substitute: crushed peanuts)
500 ml vegetable stock (use vegetable stock cube)
one table spoon of dark soy sauce
directions: Mix salt, pepper, nutmeg and turmeric in a bowl with enough of the dark soy to make a paste.
Heat oil in a sauce pan, add ginger and fry for a few seconds.
Add the peanut butter.
Stir rapidly as the peanut butter will stick to the bottom of the pan.
After 30 seconds add the stock, stir lots.
Take a ladle of the stock and add to the turmeric paste.
Stir the paste into the liquid in the bowl.
Add the rest of the soy and the turmeric mixture to the pan.
Stir.
Add the spinach or watercress to the pan.
Cook for about 5 – 10 minutes until the spinach / watercress is cooked.
Add tofu or bean curd one minute before the end if you would like it.

name: Steamed Vegetables
description: Tasty as a side dish.
ingredients: 1/2 cup green beans, cut ends off
1/4 cup dark leafy greens (I like kale), washed, chopped
directions: Prepare your vegetables (chop into bite sized pieces)
Place a steamer basket in a pot large enough to hold the vegetables, but not so large that they will fall over the sides of the basket.
Fill the bottom of the pot with a small amount of water. 4. Add vegetables and cover.
Place on high heat until they begin to steam. Reduce heat to low and let steam for 2-3 minutes more (to the tenderness you desire).
Serve them hot with a sprinkle of sea salt.
You can top with butter, margarine,  or virgin coconut oil.  Alternativly rape seed oil or olive oil have better unsaturated fat content.

name: Stuffed Mushrooms with Tomatoes and Olives
description: Portobello mushroom caps make delicious miniature casseroles. In this stuffed mushroom twist it has tomato, cheese and olive stuffing that grills up perfectly to satifsy your taste buds. Serve with a healthy green salad for a delicious meal.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp. finely chopped fresh rosemary, or 1/8 tsp. dried
directions: Combine tomatoes, cheese, olives, garlic, 1 teaspoon oil, rosemary and pepper in a small bowl.
Preheat grill to medium.
Discard mushroom stems. Remove brown gills from the undersides of the caps using a spoon; discard gills. Mix the remaining 1 teaspoon oil, lemon juice and soy sauce in a small bowl.
Brush the mixture over both sides of the caps.
Oil a grill rack. Place the caps on the rack, stem sides down, cover and grill until soft, about 5 minutes per side. Remove from the grill and fill with the tomato mixture.
Return to the grill, cover, and cook until the cheese is melted, about 3 minutes more.

name: Tomatoes Stuffed with Rice and Cheese
description: These delectably stuffed tomatoes are a perfect complement to any main dish. If you want to cut down on prep time, make the stuffing ahead of time and refrigerate.
ingredients: 1 (8 oz.) can whole kernel corn, drained
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Rinse tomatoes in cool water and remove the tops.
Spoon out the pulp and reserve in a bowl.
Sprinkle tomato shells with salt and pepper.
Turn upside down and set on paper towel to drain.
Place tomatoes in a large, greased baking dish.
Place the dish in a pan filled with ½ inch hot water.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil on a medium setting and sauté onion and green pepper until tender.
Stir in all remaining ingredients except for cheese and paprika.
Heat thoroughly.
Sprinkle tomato stuffing with cheese and paprika.
Spoon mixture into tomato shells and bake for 20 - 25 minutes.

name: Apple Smoothie
description: This has to be one of the easiest (and quickest) smoothies to make. If I am drinking this in place of a traditional breakfast, I'll use bananas. If it's meant to be a snack or dessert, I like to use frozen yogurt in place of milk.
directions: Cut apple and banana into medium sized chunks.
Add chopped fruit to blender.
Pour milk over fruit and add ice cubes.
Blend for 5-7 minutes or until smoothie is thick and creamy.

name: Collard Green Smoothie by Pce3@ij.net
description: Not only is the collard green smoothie beverage healthy and complete it takes a long time to consume it with the result of keeping you from feeling hungry until time for your next meal. An added bonus is that for a health beverage it tastes garden fresh too. (BTW - add a little vinegar to liven up the taste.)
directions: Spray unwashed leaves alternately with just enough vinegar and then hydrogen peroxide so they drip.
Rinse after 10 seconds or longer.
Remove excess water using a leafy greens centrifuge spinner
Chop sanitized collard green leaves into small pieces that will fit snugly into the blender.
Add to 48 oz. blender with other ingredients.
Add ~40oz. chilled water.
Blend on high until liquid. Enjoy!

name: Iced Tea
description: My kids love iced tea. I like to make it for them during the summer, or anytime they ask for it!
ingredients: 4 regular size tea bags (Luzianne tea is really good!)
directions: Bring tea bags and 2 cups of water to a boil.
Remove from heat and steep tea bags for 30 minutes.
Remove and get rid of tea bags once you're done steeping.
Pour tea into a ½ gallon-sized pitcher and add remaining water and sugar.
Stir well.
Serve over ice and garnish with mint (optional).

name: Mustard Green Smoothie by Pce3@ij.net
description: Not only is the mustard green smoothie beverage healthy and complete it takes a long time to consume it all and keeps you from feeling hungry until time for your next meal. An added bonus is that for a health beverage it tastes very green with a little bit of bite.
directions: Spray unwashed leaves alternately with enough vinegar and then hydrogen peroxide to make them drip.
Rinse after 10 seconds or longer.
semi-dry using leafy green centrifuge spinner
Chop sanitized mustard greens into small pieces that will fit into the blender.
Add to 48 oz. blender with other ingredients.
Add ~40oz. chilled water.
Blend on high until liquid.

name: Old Fashioned Lemonade
description: Cool off and enjoy your summer evening on the porch with a glass of lemonade!
ingredients: 1 cup white sugar (or an equivalent amount of stevia or Splenda)
directions: Using either a juicer or your hands, juice the lemons to make 1 cup of juice.
In a gallon-sized pitcher, combine lemon juice and water.
Stir in the sugar.
Allow lemonade to chill or serve over ice.

name: Red Currant Jelly Juice
description: Although this is a recipe for juice, if you skip the final step, you will end up with red currant jelly. Either way you've made a good choice!
directions: Rinse berries in cold water and remove stems.
Place berries in a large mixing bowl and mash to a pulp.
Place pulp in a clean cloth and squeeze out all of the juice over a clean bowl. Note: do not do this over the bowl used in step 2. Set aside pulp for later.
Add sugar to the juice and stir until dissolved (do not cook).
Cover and allow to chill overnight in the refrigerator.
This option is entirely up to you.
If you'd like to drink the red currant jelly, boil some water and remove the rest of the juices.
Add more sugar and a couple of ice cubes.
Enjoy your drink!.

name: Strawberry Punch
description: I consider strawberries to be the ultimate summer fruit. What better way to enjoy them than in a drink? Best when served cold.
ingredients: 1 (10 oz.) package frozen (fresh, if in season) strawberries
directions: Pour the first four ingredients into a blender and blend for 3-5 minutes, or until smooth.
Pour into punch into glasses (or punchbowl).
Allow to chill for 15 minutes.
Garnish with remaining fresh strawberries (optional).
Serve.

name: Baba Ganoush
description: Baba ganoush is a common Middle Eastern and Mediterranean dip with a creamy, somewhat smoky flavor. It is usually eaten with pita bread although naan or a crispy flatbread also work well.
ingredients: 1 medium-large eggplant, any variety, 1 to 1½ pounds
paprika or cayenne pepper, as a garnish
directions: Season the eggplant with ¼ teaspoon of salt.

Roast the eggplant. This can be done in a variety of ways, but the flesh should be fully cooked and the skin should be burned and falling off easily. An effective method is to prick the eggplant and place it a few inches under a broiler, turning it as the exposed skin blackens, about every 3–4 minutes. Place a pan underneath to catch the juices, and discard them.
Scrape off the eggplant skin.
It's all right if you miss a few burned bits.
Finely chop or blend the eggplant flesh with the rest of the ingredients.
The consistency should be smooth.
